update.description:
This PR addresses issue #2.

Currently, this enforces a tilde `~` between the version numbers and the prerelease suffix (which is allowed to be any string). We can change this if anyone would prefer that the separator be explicitly specified (e.g. `ign_configure_project(common 0.1.0 VERSION_SUFFIX ~pre)` instead of `ign_configure_project(common 0.1.0 VERSION_SUFFIX pre)`).

From cmake's point of view, the prerelease suffix is entirely superficial. This will not really support the ability to have both a prerelease and final release of the same version installed at the same time. (Well, you can have them both installed at the same time, but you cannot use find_package in cmake to select the prerelease version instead of the final release version.)
update.title: Supporting prerelease versions of ignition projects

content.raw:
I think that the PR implements pretty well what we have been discussing in issue #2. I made a small change in [6d318b8](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/commits/6d318b828044c618948699f34dc17b80016a1f68?at=default) to include a version in the pre suffix of the example, I think that it fits exactly what we will use in real cases. Hopefully I did not break anything.

Nice work Michael, thanks!
content.html:
I think that the PR implements pretty well what we have been discussing in issue #2. I made a small change in 6d318b8 to include a version in the pre suffix of the example, I think that it fits exactly what we will use in real cases. Hopefully I did not break anything.

Nice work Michael, thanks!
